properties.name: Malabo
properties.define: The stadium holds 15,250 and opened in 2007. It is currently the home ground of the Equatorial Guinea national football team.

properties.name: Bata
properties.define: Estadio de Bata is a multi-use stadium in Bata, Equatorial Guinea. The stadium was constructed by the Chinese contractor Covec and completed in 2007 with a capacity of 22,000 people.

properties.name: Mongomo
properties.define: The Estadio de Mongomo is a multi-sports stadium in Mongomo, Equatorial Guinea. In November 2014, it was announced the stadium will be a venue for the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations.

properties.name: Ebebiyín
properties.define: The Neuvo Estadio de Ebebiyín is a multi-sports stadium in Ebebiyín, Equatorial Guinea. In October 2014, the stadium hosted the Copa de la Primera Dama final.
